website_summaries.verdict: The Elgato Eve Degree works well enough, and a niche audience might get some value from it. But most consumers will not find it a compelling device.
pros: The Elgato Eve Degree tracks temperature, humidity and air pressure well, and it can trigger HomeKit scenes
cons: The Degree takes awhile to adjust its temperature readings, its HomeKit integration is frustrating and it’s hard to imagine many people paying $70 for a sensor, even if it were excellent

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Battery life
customer_reviews.text: According to Elgato this should last a year on one battery. I get about 2 weeks. I'm trying to find a place where maybe the Bluetooth won't have to work as hard, but yeah, this is definitely not something I'd buy again or recommend to others. I wanted it to monitor humidity in my basement and use with Homekit, but the battery life is almost a non starter. Since I bought a 10 pack of batteries for it, I'll see if I can find a place where it doesn't eat batteries as much, but if not, into a drawer it'll go :(
customer_reviews.author: John Wilker

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy "Eve Degree"
customer_reviews.text: Response of Temperature Fall/Rise very Slow and Below 15°C not only that Apple home Kit Function not activated the rules for Switch ON/OFF Function. As for Example I keep it on Refrigerator for 2 min. to test the temperature response of "EVE Degree" but I am very upset to say that Temperature Show 25.3° C (Normal Temp was 27.5°C) simultaneously my old "METRAVI Digital Temperature and Humidity Meter" Show 1.5°C in same duration Cost INR 600 Only and I pay amazon for "EVE Degree" $93.91 including all to reach my home. I like to receive resonance from EVE Degree Technical Department. Sl No. of My Product SU26G1A04786. Please launch Product after adequate testing from concern department. That's all.
customer_reviews.author: Karan

customer_reviews.title: The weather station is only Buetooth, so it has ...
customer_reviews.text: The weather station is only Buetooth, so it has to be next to your Apple TV so it can be viewed via internet. I would give it 5 stars, if it was also WiFi, so you can extend the coverage in your house via your WiFi network
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Sagastume

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to our “Smart” Home
customer_reviews.text: The Eve Degree is excellent! We use it to trigger our barn fan to turn on or off depending on how hot it is outside so our horses don’t get too hot. It works perfectly. If you’re reading all the reviews that say the range is bad, I have no idea what they are talking about. Our Apple TV is our hub in our living room, and our Degree is outside our front door, at least 15ft away. No range issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Akvan

customer_reviews.title: Isn’t design for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: This device is not actually made to be outside as far as I can tell. The device is black, and if left in direct sunlight will tell you that it’s 190 degrees outside. I have had to hide this device so that it doesn’t get too hot? So the display is useless to me. I have hear other say it doesn’t work if it lets too cold either. The device is also Bluetooth only, so wherever it is, it need to be very close to you hub. Again, not ideal for an outdoor device. Over all, it’s ok, but seams to be designed for form over function. Look for an alternate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but the battery life isn't great
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, and I would buy it again. Pros: • Nice design • Easy to read • Works great with HomeKit • The wireless connection to HomeKit is rock solid Cons: • The battery life isn't good. I've had this for 2 months, and the battery is already down to 30%. It's possible that the battery was already partly depleted when I got the unit. (I didn't check when I first installed it.) I suppose if I was going to buy another temperature sensor, I might consider another brand due to the battery life. However, it's not a deal breaker for me. Everything else about the unit is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: James Astro

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the low profile but not worth the cost when the iHome device is $25 cheaper and much more reliable. I bought each device and put one on each level of my home. This device requires yet another app to be added to the phone but does work on the home app. I could not get the face of the device to read in fahrenheit even though the app was set as such. In three days I began getting a low battery reading. I've read in other reviews that I just needed to reset the device but why pay more for all this trouble. I returned it and will eventually purchase another ihome device.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Queen

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Failed after a few months, moisture damage i think as water was beaded up once i took off the cover. Update: It's clearly not waterproof, but the moisture didn't seem to harm it. I tried it out indoors with a new battery, I did like the fact it would record the temperature for days and was expecting longer batter life. What's horrid about this product is the 1 month battery life and the lack of warning when the battery is low. The battery needs to either last a year or the product needs to be rechargeable. I was really excited about this product because they have one of the better homekit apps, but just an epic fail.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Problems with accuracy. Having two devices in one room they show different temperatures. 2. Connection. As a Bluetooth device it needs to stay connected to your phone. You will not be able to see the temperature at home if you are away with your phone. The homekit integration only works if the app is open and the device is in range. Pointless. 3. Bad battery life. 5. Looks nice, but expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Michellann

customer_reviews.title: Simple Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: Simple to connect weather station. Tracks the temp, humidity well. Seems to be accurate when compared to local thermometer and local news. I like to look at the temp trends which this keeps for you. Very small and easy to locate where you need temps, etc recorded. I use one in my crawl space in the winters to monitor temps for freezing problems...
customer_reviews.author: Yankee Man

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. It burns through batteries within a week or two
customer_reviews.text: The unit was dead on arrival and initial set up. Would not start up or respond to reset button. They appear to have quality issues. I replaced the battery and it drains very quickly. Eve products are pretty but they are poorly engineered and just not work the cost of batteries and time. I will not buy another one of their products.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great product terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have had my degree for a bit now and it is fantastic, however the gasket has rotted out and customer service will not contact me. I would like some replacements. I’ll pay for them, but there is no one to talk to. If anyone has any idea how to get ahold of them please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Accurate digital temp
customer_reviews.text: Accurate digital temp and keeps daily stats graph on your phone or tablet with the app. I used it for scientific research. Very good to keep data.
customer_reviews.author: MHR5or0⭐️

customer_reviews.title: Great for monitoring the house comfort levels
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! I use it to control a humidifier in my house (via HomeKit) I like that it tells me relative humidity AND temperature. Pretty sweet. Have put about two months on the current batteries and haven't received a low battery warning. Super compact and sleek. Beautifully designed. Never have an issue with connection either.
customer_reviews.author: Caelan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a new Eve Room (with small screen) with this Eve Degree. Degree cost less, has a bigger screen, and longer battery life - the only thing missing is air quality and I have found that to be less useful. Plus the Air quality in the "Room" uses more battery. For best all around use I LIKE the Eve Degree better.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: using this product can get you smart home cooling and heat
customer_reviews.text: I’m really liking Elgato’s Eve line of products. Living in an apartment with no central heat or ac, using this product can get you smart home cooling and heat! Hook it up with HomeKit. And have it control a HomeKit outlet. If it gets to hot, the AC goes on, too cold, no problem, the heater goes on. When it’s perfect I’m not wasting any power, since everything is off.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with the Elgato outlet for an old window air conditioner that runs nonstop. I set it up in Apple home to turn on and off based on the temperature in my daughter’s room
customer_reviews.author: Laura Smith

customer_reviews.title: The quality is there!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice piece, very well put together. It shows the temperature, and humidity level in the app. But that’s about it. I think it’s a little pricey for what it is, but it IS weatherproof which adds to manufacturing costs. The display isn’t back lit, but that doesn’t seem to matter. I can see it well in any light and can even make it out in total darkness. I think $49 would be a solid price for this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Denton

customer_reviews.title: Eve has almost all the best gear
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t have an air quality sensor, but there is another Eve sensor for that. This makes a great pairing with that other sensor, for those spaces where you’re more concerned about just the temperature and humidity and not so much about the air quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Great product (Updated BUT !!!!!!!!)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Device seems to work great, BUT, as soon as you use it to start running automations the battery drains extremely fast, other than that love the device, but dropping $5 for a new battery every few 2-3 months seems like a hassle for having this device. Running two automations to turn on and off fans around the house based on temperatures. Was using my smart thermostat to control automations for other devices, but the thermostat in question kept losing HomeKit integration connectivity, so just decided to purchase this device and works like a charm, smaller than I expected, but yet love it, integration is flawless so far and setup was a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Fabs

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries for lunch
customer_reviews.text: First it worked great, then the display quit during a failed update. It won't update even when sitting right next to my iPad. Then after 3 weeks the batteries were dead. Really? 3 weeks and I have to replace the batteries already? On a good note it does work well turning on things when I want although it is slow to update when I ask for the temp.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Never buy Eve products
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked for awhile (after 3+hours getting it going) and then just stopped working. Support was absurd like "+## pleas type your reply above ##+"....what??? Then asked about the display which I answered in great detail then.....wait for it...NOTHING! given the 30 + hours I have invested in setting this up and trying to make it work Id say avoid EVE Im not a mena guy but come on Man!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Great in concept but would only work for a few days at a time
customer_reviews.text: The idea was great in concept and I would use it to trigger my dehumidifier.... but even after firmware updates the device would chew through a new battery in a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn and Patrick

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for several months now and the range is horrible. I have to almost be touching it with my phone before it will connect. I wish it worked as well as their door sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I wasted my time buying. Customer support is not educated The product works with the iPhone but only with in 10 feet away. What’s the point???
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Costly, but works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is my first HomeKit device. I use it for remote monitoring of indoor temperature at our vacation home through an AppleTV. It's a lot of money for what it does, but it tells me what I wanted to know.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: it works, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The most important feature I wanted was a notification via email of text if temp went above or below a certain range. You can't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Fan

customer_reviews.title: Seems useful but pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Seems useful, but pricey. Also while standing side by side, Eve Room and Eve Degree show different readings on temperature and humidity. Quite suspicious unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Valchinov

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2 in August 2018, both dead by December 8th.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they are compatible with Apple's Homekit. First one ordered August 8th, completely dead within an hour. No display, no bluetooth. Returned for replacement which arrived August 15th. Worked until mid November when the Bluetooth died, so it no longer responds to the Home APP. The display is still working however. Purchased a second unit for another room, arrived August 30th. Bluetooth died December 7th, and the display is off. You can press the button to change between Temp / Humidity, and it will display for about an hour. Totally unacceptable for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Just Al

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well (updated)
customer_reviews.text: *update* 7 months later, it’s used fir batteries already. This feels like way too much! Overall does a solid job and allows me to check my home environment from anywhere in the world. A little slow to connect, and the battery lasts 3 months (compared to quoted 1year).
customer_reviews.author: Tosh

customer_reviews.title: “Hey Siri, what’s the humidity in my humidor?” Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for checking on your cigars from ANYWHERE. All you need is an iPhone and an internet connection! “Hey Siri, what’s the humidity in my humidor?” Works great with the 4th gen Apple TV as the HomeKit hub. This think is awesome!!! I set mine up in HomeKit by creating a room named My Humidor, then added the EVE Degree to that room. This allows Siri to respond when you ask here about your Humidor.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Been working great now for awhile. Great integration with HomeKit and good range
customer_reviews.author: Russell J.

customer_reviews.title: poor connectivity
customer_reviews.text: often does not connect to my wifi and if it does it takes a looooong time to update status. yes its supposed to receive excellent wifi coverage, no that doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Wiryan Tirtarahardja

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month then died.
customer_reviews.text: This lasted just past the one month return window. Totally dead and useless. Can't recommend. Did what it was supposed to for the few days it was functional.
customer_reviews.author: Greenwood Family

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate device
customer_reviews.text: It is a very accurate device and the app for iPhone works perfectly. The only thing that needs improvement is the Bluetooth range. The battery life is very good!
customer_reviews.author: Horacio Martinez-Thormann

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice. Unreliable interface and short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Although the device looks nice, there are 2 issues I had. One is the battery life. Ive had it a couple of months and have already replaced it, Secondly, the interface is VERY unreliable and inconsistent. Advanced customer service is, kindly speaking, inept. Wished it did what was advertised but it doesn’t. For the price of the device, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Warranty
customer_reviews.text: the screen stopped working 6 months after the purchase and there is no effective guarantee response from its customer service agents.
customer_reviews.author: Jhonnathan Ramírez Gutiérrez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Nice to see more products supporting Apple HomeKit. This thing is simple and effective. Happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is only 2-3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is only 2-3 weeks which makes is REALLY annoying and pretty much not worth it...
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: You can barely see the numbers on the display display
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Does an excellent job
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased to perform a specific function & does an excellent job
customer_reviews.author: M. Koszyk

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built and stays connected
customer_reviews.text: The unit does a good job of staying connected. Solid build quality and easy to read at a distance in lighted environment. I just wish the display mode had an option to alternatively display temp and humidity.
customer_reviews.author: brownie ann

customer_reviews.title: Does its job. Even outdoor.
customer_reviews.text: Does its job. Although sometimes it goes "unresponsive", but that could be siri. I wish it could forecast weather, especially when put outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: It’s smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: Very simple setup up, great design and totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE JORGE TOLENTINO DE CASTRO JUNIOR

customer_reviews.title: Wildly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Wildly inaccurate as an outdoor thermometer. Placed on a covered porch out of direct sunlight, yet sensor reports 120 deg F when it’s actually 85 deg F. Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Life, Poor Value
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for only 8 months before it completely quit working. It was located outside on a covered back porch. Loved the features while it worked, but for this price it should last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: James S

customer_reviews.title: Died after 8 months worth of use. Changed battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Died after 8 months worth of use. Changed battery and it never came back on. Wifi was very weak, could only connect from the same room.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but it is not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I thought it would have a more accurate reading. Compared to another source, this device is 1C above all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Óscar Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months hardware failure.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware failure and the Eve Degree stop working. Can you fix this?
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sarzynski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a very cool little addition, but, it definitely needs some kind of backlighting for the display.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Cass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Immediately sends data to the app once it’s opened.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Pricey
customer_reviews.text: Nice and simple but about $20 - $30 more than it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Concepcion

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have the display
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Nice to have the display. No backlight (maybe to keep battery life?)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months but replaced easily.
customer_reviews.text: Just stopped working after a few months but Eve replaced it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Helpful little gadget
customer_reviews.text: Already had one of these in my living room, decided to pick one up for outside. Does a great job and the EVE app is great for tracking data trends
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and one time setup. The tasteful design make it suitable for any room.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Scott Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Trigger a LOW or HIGH Temperature Notification!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item appeared used, with scratches and scuffs on the display. My biggest complaint was that it cannot send a low or high temperature notification. It's a strictly passive device that requires you to check the temperature. I am incredulous that a $67 "smart" home device could not let me know if the temperature dropped below a preset threshold. This is a serious limitation that made this device completely useless for my purpose, so it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Lori H.

customer_reviews.title: It sends the readings to my phone just fine, but c'mon guys
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Eve product. Must say, they have a quality control issue. Bought this to replace 2 older gen Elgato Outdoor sensors which both stopped working during the first 72hours. Now this product I've had for 2 weeks. Seems to work ok, but the display is buggy. Whenever temp is >100F, the middle digit fails to display. It sends the readings to my phone just fine, but c'mon guys, spend a little effort to get things right or else your little startup company will not get any repeat customers, bad referrals, and poor ratings.
customer_reviews.author: jgw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service and delivery speed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service and delivery speed. The sensor works as designed and is exactly what I wanted to monitor my home.
customer_reviews.author: coverthawk

customer_reviews.title: Left feeling dissatisfied for the hefty price tag
customer_reviews.text: Sort of left me feeling disappointed for the high price tag. The description shows it’s supposed to be very accurate a point which I doubt. The display and even HomeKit only shows maybe within half a degree. The app is the only way to see the exact (probably inaccurate) temperature. A $20 weather device seems to display more accurate temperatures. And the battery is already %15 dead. The other product we have from them is accurate and instant and the battery is still full after 6 months. Probably will not buy anything that measures from this company again. Unless a future update allows for the display to show the exact temperature
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T.

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I return the first one and ask for replacement and I got a new one yesterday and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Can't use temperature to control devices in home kit
customer_reviews.text: Will only display temperature in Home kit - does not allow for any type of control over using temperature as a trigger. I had wanted to use this device to trigger a wemo switch to turn on/off depending on temperature. The Elgato app might have this functionality, but creates an unnecessary extra layer of using their app to setup.
customer_reviews.author: B Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Works as describes
customer_reviews.text: Like the unit, works as describes, but why so small? Fits in the palm of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

product_meta.title: Eve Degree - Connected Weather Station for tracking temperature, humidity & air pressure; IPX3 water resistance, display, no bridge necessary, Bluetooth Low Energy (Apple HomeKit)
product_meta.description: Masterfully crafted from anodized aluminium, Eve Degree tracks outdoor temperature, humidity, and air pressure with unrivalled precision. See conditions at a glance. Review current and past climate data right on your iPhone or iPad. And acquire insight that'll make your inner weather watcher go wild. Taking advantage of Apple's revolutionary Home Kit technology, Eve offers unparalleled ease of use, advanced security, and tight integration with Siri. Eve Degree is powered by a long-lasting, replaceable battery and boasts truly wireless, energy-efficient operation thanks to cutting-edge Bluetooth Low Energy technology.
feature_bullets: Track outdoor temperature, humidity, and air pressure
See temperature or humidity directly on the LCD display
View your data by day, month or year
Anodized aluminium body with IPX 3 water resistance
Home Kit-enabled for unparalleled ease of use and advanced security
Ask Siri for temperature and humidity measurements

specifications.Included Components: Eve Degree; CR 2450 Replaceable Battery; Quick Start Guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars150 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
